intro: Xanthocephalum dentatum, commonly known as the serrated everlasting pea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, round pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Xanthocephalum dentatum is also used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
